messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re:Himeji-jo Occupants
messages.msgSnippet: After Ikeda, Honda Tadamasa  1617-39 Matsudaira Tadaaki and his son Tadahiro 1639-49 Matsudaira Naomoto and his son Naohiro 1648-49 Sakakibara Tadatsugu and
messages.messageBody:
After Ikeda,
Honda Tadamasa 1617-39
Matsudaira Tadaaki and his son Tadahiro 1639-49
Matsudaira Naomoto and his son Naohiro 1648-49
Sakakibara Tadatsugu and his son Masafusa 1649-82
Honda Tadakuni and his son Tadataka 1682-1704
Sakakibara Masakuni 1704-1749
Sakai Tadasumi 1749-succeeded by eight descendants until the Bakumatsu
period.

These are the names I could find I think that there are more names but I
believe these are the families that ruled Himeji-Jo during the Edo period.
By the way it was Tokugawa Ieyasu that bestowed the castle onto Ikeda,
Toyotomi Hideyoshi was the hegemon that ruled before Tokugawa
----- Original Message -----
From: Clifford <cbeard@...>
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 24, 2002 5:08 AM
Subject: [samuraihistory] Re:Himeji-jo Occupants


> Hi,
> Tokugawa Hideyoshi gave the Himeji castle (it is also know as
Shirasagi (White Egret)), to Ikeda Terumasa after defeating Toyotomi's
armies. It was then occupied by 48 succeeding Lords. Could anyone thro any
light on their names please.
> Cliff B.

messages.subject: Re:Himeji-jo Occupants
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Tokugawa Hideyoshi gave the Himeji castle (it is also know as Shirasagi (White Egret)), to Ikeda Terumasa after defeating Toyotomi s armies.  It was then
messages.messageBody:
Hi,
Tokugawa Hideyoshi gave the Himeji castle (it is also know as Shirasagi (White Egret)), to Ikeda Terumasa after defeating Toyotomi's armies. It was then occupied by 48 succeeding Lords. Could anyone thro any light on their names please.
Cliff B.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
